title: Problem 5
content:
(10 points)
The table below contains Chuvash verbs (in Latin transliteration) and their English translations. Some of the data has been left out.

| Chuvash Verb   | English Translation          |
|----------------|------------------------------|
| aman           | to be crippled               |
| amant          | to cripple                   |
| aptra          | to suffer                    |
| ?              | to torment                   |
| avăn           | to be flexible               |
| av             | to bend                      |
| çĕt            | to get lost                  |
| çĕter          | to lose                      |
| çit            | to reach                     |
| ?              | to lead                      |
| čühen          | ?                            |
| čühe           | to rinse                     |
| hupăn          | ?                            |
| ?              | to close                     |
| hurăn          | to lie (e.g., on the table)  |
| hur            | to lay (e.g., something on the table) |
| kaç            | to move (e.g., from one flat to another) |
| ?              | to transport                 |
| kӑvakar        | to become blue               |
| kӑvakart       | to make blue                 |
| kuç            | to migrate                   |
| kuçar          | to resettle                  |
| puçtarӑn       | to get together              |
| puçtar         | to gather                    |
| shӑn           | ?                            |
| shӑnt          | to put on ice                |
| taptan         | to be trampled               |
| tapta          | to trample down              |
| tupӑn          | to be found                  |
| tup            | to find                      |
| uçӑn           | to be revealed               |
| uç             | to reveal                    |
| ük             | ?                            |
| üker           | to drop                      |
| vacka          | to be in a hurry             |
| vackat         | to precipitate               |
| varalan        | to be smirched               |
| varala         | to besmirch                  |
| vĕre           | to be boiling                |
| vĕret          | to boil (e.g., water)        |
| vĕren          | to learn                     |
| verent         | to teach                     |
| vitĕn          | to be covered                |
| vit            | to cover                     |
| ?              | to enter                     |
| kĕrt           | to hide oneself              |
| pytar          | to hide (something)          |

Assignment. Fill in the gaps. If in some cases you cannot form a Chuvash verb with certainty, list all possibilities. Explain your solution.

Note. ӑ is pronounced as a short a, ĕ is pronounced as a short e, ü is pronounced similarly to English ew as in stew, 
ç is pronounced similarly to English c as in cereal, č is pronounced similarly to English ch as in church.

---

Good luck!
